image.altText: A group of three men and two women walking.

props.synopsis: A close friend of Matt Wright has insisted he "wouldn't remember" if the Netflix star had asked him to destroy a document sought by investigators probing a fatal helicopter crash in 2022.

title.children: Matt Wright's friend accused of 'ridiculous', 'nonsensical' evidence

image.altText: A Northern Territory Police car.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a 48-year-old man over the alleged fatal poisoning of his female partner in March last year.

title.children: Man charged 18 months after alleged fatal poisoning of female partner

image.altText: Royal Darwin Hospital Intensive Care Unit

props.synopsis: The controversial Acacia system will be switched on at Alice Springs and Tennant Creek hospitals on Saturday, despite lingering doubts about the project's safety.

title.children: 'Unsafe' patient record system to go live at two NT hospitals

image.altText: Brad and Jason Moon

props.synopsis: A family in the Northern Territory have quit their day jobs to focus on growing their passionfruit business.

title.children: Tradie's foray into passionfruit growing drives thriving family business

image.altText: A selfie image of three people, with the one on the right blurred. Two men on left, one older (left) and younger (right).

props.synopsis: The trial of a man accused of killing his father after a violent fight in the backyard of a suburban Darwin home has begun in the Northern Territory Supreme Court.

title.children: Trial of man accused of killing father in backyard begins in Darwin

image.altText: Crocodile eggs in a tray with one that's pipped being held up by someone's hand.

props.synopsis: The charges, laid by the Australian Federal Police, relate to alleged illegal activity at the NT's Kakadu National Park in early 2024.

title.children: Two men involved in fatal chopper crash charged over stealing crocodile eggs

image.altText: A man stands in the sun on a green oval and smiles broadly as he holds a soccer ball.

props.synopsis: Eighteen-year-old Lesley Thompson will travel to Oslo for an international street soccer tournament that aims to challenge attitudes about homelessness.

title.children: Homeless Alice Springs man to play soccer for Australia in Norway

image.altText: Izak Rankine of the Crows prepares before a game.

props.synopsis: Young LGBTQIA+ Australians are turning away from community sport due to the high prevalence of homophobia, queerphobia and discrimination.

title.children: Rankine's ban pales in comparison to widespread impact of homophobia

image.altText: IzakRankine

props.synopsis: The penalties we issue in response to racism and homophobia matter. They send a powerful message about what we regard as acceptable.

title.children: There is nothing hard about this conversation. Homophobia is unacceptable on and off the field

image.altText: A man celebrates after scoring a try in an NRL match

props.synopsis: The Rabbitohs have cantered to a thumping 40-0 victory over the Dragons with Alex Johnston scoring the 210 try of his career to move one step closer to breaking the all-time record.

title.children: Johnston edges closer to all-time try-scoring mark in Souths thrashing

image.altText: Albanese and Chalmers sit on lounges in a living room smiling, as Chalmers pets a small fluffy white dog.

props.synopsis: This week in politics was all about productivity while the health minister blindsided the states and Israel's prime minister criticised Anthony Albanese.

title.children: Treasurer and PM get on the same page as Butler blindsides

image.altText: A bridge next to a cityscape

props.synopsis: Organisers had expected crowds of 7,000 at a planned march across the bridge this weekend, but police raised safety concerns.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protest won't be allowed on Brisbane's Story Bridge

image.altText: Aerial shot of white van in flood water

props.synopsis: Rain across large parts of New South Wales has not been as heavy as predicted, but residents are being warned flash flooding remains a risk.

title.children: Schools closed and drivers rescued as rain lashes NSW

image.altText: Two anonymous primary school-aged boys walk and balance on playground equipment in a park.

props.synopsis: The quicker the details of these next steps of reform are ironed out, the quicker the government and families can have certainty in a sustainable future for themselves and the NDIS.

title.children: The NDIS was never designed to support everyone. Now come the tough decisions

image.altText: Israel Palestinians Gaza

props.synopsis: Israel describes the city as a Hamas stronghold, but it is also one of the last places of refuge of hundreds of thousands of Palestinians already displaced in almost two years of war.

title.children: Israel's assault on Gaza City has begun — here's what you need to know

image.altText: Kylie Minogue standing on stage with four members of K-pop boy band Ateez

props.synopsis: A new music competition show in which global icons team up with K-pop idols to have their songs KPopped features Australian pop princess Kylie Minogue.

title.children: What does it mean to have your song KPopped? Kylie Minogue, the Spice Girls and Boy George find out

image.altText: Australian striker Sam Kerr runs away from goal with fists pumped and a smile on her face.

props.synopsis: Matildas superstar striker Sam Kerr is closing in on her long-awaited playing return with Chelsea and is setting high expectations of herself in front of goal.

title.children: 'It's goals — that's what I'm here to do': Sam Kerr sets big targets as injury return nears

image.altText: A large sign saying Austin on the side of a grey building.

props.synopsis: Ryan Cho was initially charged with a handful of offences to do with alleged intimate images of colleagues in staff toilets, but is now facing more than 100 fresh charges.

title.children: Junior doctor facing 127 more charges over illegal recording device

image.altText: The remains of a large puffed up globe fish sit on the sand of a surf beach.

props.synopsis: A US scientist invited to South Australia for his algal bloom expertise, says modified clay could be an effective small scale mitigation measure — but warned there is no way to predict when the bloom will disappear.

title.children: US expert says there's no way to predict when SA's algal bloom will disperse

image.altText: Two men in white labcoats standing in a laboratory

props.synopsis: Scientists hope the breakthrough can be used to help study rare genetic skin diseases.

title.children: World-first living skin grown in Queensland lab

image.altText: An aerial view of the Macquarie marshes, featuring vibrant green vegetation surrounding water containing a flock of birds.

props.synopsis: Australia has been accused of failing its international obligation to look after a Ramsar-listed ecosystem after the federal government paused environmental water flows in New South Wales.

title.children: Halt on all environmental water flows in NSW prompts anger

image.altText: Exterior of the District Court of Western Australia on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: A relief teacher who groomed and had sex with a teenage student and engaged in online offending with even younger girls is sentenced to more than seven years in prison.

title.children: 'Depraved and offensive': WA teacher jailed over multiple child sex offences

image.altText: Noor, with a headscarf, glasses and earmuffs on, smiles at the camera as she holds the handle of a circular saw

props.synopsis: When Noor's husband died, she turned to his "play space" — the local men's shed in the old logging town they called home. She's not the only woman who's been welcomed into the inclusive community.

title.children: This men's shed is ditching the exclusivity, becoming an 'anyone's shed'

image.altText: An orange billboard to the left of a service lane

props.synopsis: Victoria's only One Nation MP says she had no idea a billboard her party installed in her electorate would blame the country's rental crisis on high immigration.

title.children: One Nation MP urges party to change billboard message deemed 'hateful'

image.altText: A damaged police car on the side of a road

props.synopsis: A police officer has been airlifted to hospital and an elderly woman has been left with serious injuries after two separate crashes involving police vehicles on Thursday.

title.children: Officer, elderly woman seriously injured in separate crashes involving police cars

image.altText: Ukraine's ambassador to Japan Sergiy Korsunsky walks past a map.

props.synopsis: A decade ago, Donetsk was the metropolis of Ukraine's east. Now, Russian President Vladimir Putin reportedly has it squarely in his sights.

title.children: The territories Putin wants and what it will mean for Ukraine

image.altText: A man with his face covered waves a black flag, on top of photos of Wisam Haddad and Youssef Uweinat and an image of a protest.

props.synopsis: Sydney cleric Wisam Haddad is working with a convicted terrorism recruiter to exploit the pro-Palestinian movement, radicalise Australian teens and feed Islamic State's revival, an ABC investigation reveals.

title.children: Sydney cleric, IS child groomer target pro-Palestinian cause for recruits

image.altText: A taxidermied wolf-like animal in a glass cabinet

props.synopsis: The search for what was killing sheep in South Australia's south-east caused a sensation across Australia. Questions remain about what type of animal it was.

title.children: Questions remain over Tantanoola tiger 130 years after it was shot dead

image.altText: A sheep stands in a pen among others.

props.synopsis: Officers euthanase more than 1,700 sheep and find more than 700 sheep dead on Steven John Ralston's Chinkapook farm within three months.

title.children: Jail for Victorian farmer whose neglect caused death of 2,500 sheep

image.altText: A black farmed mobile phone featuring a Meta logo in front of blurred social media platform logos

props.synopsis: Dozens of readers have contacted the ABC saying their digital lives have been up-ended by the mass Meta suspensions. Experts say now is the time to back up your treasured memories.

title.children: Falsely banned Meta users devastated at losing sentimental memories

image.altText: Elon Musk (left) stands beside Donald Trump who is sitting down.

props.synopsis: The lawsuit alleges that the daily giveaways wrongly induced people to provide personal identifying information late in the 2024 US election campaign.

title.children: Judge orders Musk to face lawsuit over $US1 million daily giveaways

image.altText: Three firefighters outside a building which has orange flames coming from the roof at night.

props.synopsis: Police have charge a 20-year-old man from Melbourne's north over the arson attack in December 2024, which gutted the synagogue in Ripponlea.

title.children: Police charge second man over Melbourne synagogue firebombing

image.altText: A man holding a brown kelpie puppy dog.

props.synopsis: Nearly two months since the tragic death of his wife and champion kelpie, Muster Dogs TV personality Frank Finger is adjusting to a new way of life.

title.children: Adored Muster Dogs trainer starts healing process after family heartbreak
